/coaching.title: COACHING - HELPING OTHERS FIND INSIGHT
/coaching.description: Coaching is like midwifery. A midwife can not give birth to the baby, she facilitates the birth. Similarly, a coach can not give a solution, she must give birth to the insight from within the coachee. Coaching is asking questions, guiding, and facilitating understanding, and this post collects my studies on the topic.

/curious.title: ISN'T THAT CURIOUS
/curious.description: Lead with curiosity, not judgment. This applies to yourself and to others. Think of a grandmother - a grandmother is full of love and compassion for her grandchildren. She loves them without conditions, no strings attached.She takes care of her grandchildren without needing anything in return. She cares selflessly and she has only the childrenâs best interest in mind. As she loves her grandchildren, she wonât allow self-destructive behavior and will step in when necessary. But she will always do this with the utmost care and love.

/insecure.title: INSECURITY AND IMPOSTER SYNDROME
/insecure.description: We all get it. imposter syndrome, which include shame

/money.title: TAX AND SAVING
/money.description: Most of the tax information on the web is a mess. Itâs confusing as it tries to apply to everyone, with varying situations, and is often written by non-engineers for non-engineers. I think my tax situation is common to people who have been in software engineering companies for most of their careers, and here are my notes

/why-is-no-one-referring.title: WHY IS NOONE REFERRING MY PROJECT
/why-is-no-one-referring.description: Your customers donât provide referrals because itâs a risk to their credibility. Remove the credibility risk, and your referrals will follow.

/books-that-defined-me.title: BOOKS THAT DEFINED ME
/books-that-defined-me.description: Books allow great thoughts to enter our mind and mold us into who we want to become. These are the books that are molding me.

/siy.title: SEARCH INSIDE YOURSELF
/siy.description: Training Emotional Intelligence through mindfulness. Search inside yourself is a meditation training manual for engineers. Itâs also a pun as the author works at google, and built the program internally at Google.

/essentialism.title: ESSENTIALISIM
/essentialism.description: Essentialism is deciding what goes on your todo list, not how many things you can cross off.

/humans-are-underrated.title: HUMANS ARE UNDERRATED
/humans-are-underrated.description: As robots become better then humans at most things, what roles will be left for humans? What skills are required for those roles? Empathizing, collaborating, leading,and building relationships.

/don-juan.title: FOUR ENEMIES
/don-juan.description: Fear, Arrogrance, Authority and Old Age, are the four enemies of satisfication as described in Don Juanâs teachings.

/getting-to-yes-with-yourself.title: GETTING TO YES WITH YOURSELF
/getting-to-yes-with-yourself.description:
Before you can negotiate with others, you need to be in sync with yourself. This book applies the negotiating principles to yourself.

This is a summary of Getting to yes with yourself

1) Put yourself in your shoes â


  Figure out what your elephant REALLY wants (Switch)
  Seek first to understand yourself (7H)
  When you judge yourself, you shutdown and canât find what you really want
  Acceptance induces safety, and only from safety can you find what you really want
  See yourself form the balcony
    
      Respond instead of reacting.
      Going to Balcony == Be Mindful, Self Aware and Objective
      Choose your response, but itâs a two sided stick and you get the consequences.
      Reaction:
        
          Feels good, but need to realize there is a VERY negative consequence.
          Negative Reactions: Attack (Win:Lose) -> Accommodate (Lose:Win) -> Avoid (Lose:Lose)
        
      
      Use self-awareness to catch your desire to react
        
          Need to build self-awareness muscle (SIY)
          Practice mindfulness (and have a grounding spot)
          Practice mindfulness before event to make it easier.
        
      
    
  
  Listen with Empathy
    
      80% of thoughts are negative.
      Observe self: Detached view of a scientist.
      Listen to self: What it feels like to be you.
      Listening to self exercise
        
          Donât judge, or they will not feel safe, and wonât talk.
          Name your neurosis, and sit them down at a table, and listen to them non-judgementally
          Because ânegative emotions are safe to speakâ they get less power, and have less desire to attack at âbadâ times.
          Donât just listen, understand the cause, and what you can do to help.
          Be curious, ask yourself, isnât that interesting. Ask the neurosis, why is that.
        
      
      This is an opportunity to learn physical self awareness, to help notice your emotions.
      Huge benefit, your mind is more clear, and you silence the self to concentrate and get into flow.
    
  
  Uncover your needs
    
      Your elephant is non-verbal, negative emotions are itâs mode of communicating your needs.
      Dig hard for your needs, donât settle for a position, but why, what do you really want. What is done. (XREF: Essentialisim)
      Magic Question Why? Why? Why?
      Deepest needs: Happiness: Protection/Safety and Love/Connection
    
  
  From Self Judgment to Self Understanding
    
      Before fighting with others, need to make sure you TRUELY know what you want.
      Accepting yourself for who you are is NOT a cop out. Acceptance produces safety, which lets us digg deater.
    
  


2) Develop your inner BATNA â

The ideas in this chapter are great, but I think connecting the concepts to inner BATNA is ackward. Thus my summary doesnât track well with the books


  A cross between 7H: Be Proactive, AND take responsibility for meeting your own needs.
  When you COMMIT to unconditionally take care of your needs, you have all the power.
    
      SWITCH: Your elephant can rest assured it will be fed and cared for regardless of whatâs going on externally.
      This gives you much more psychic space in your relationships, making them better relationships.
      SIY: Grandmother mind - you are your own best grandma.
    
  
  Responsibility holds Power VS blame gives it away.
  Take responsibility for what youâve got, and make the most of it - DO NOT BLAME Life (welcome to Holland).
  Focus on what you can do to make things better, NOT the fact that you screwed something up in the past.
  
    In a relationship, focus on what YOU CAN DO going forward in the relationship, not on blaming the other person. Doing this:

    
      Gives clarity to your needs in the relationships.
      Gives âpsychic spaceâ for other party in relationship
      Lets you be objectives about your needs, and your expectations from other party.
    
  
  Own your life
    
      Need self-understanding and self-responsibility
        
          Just self-understanding => self-pity
          Just self-responsibility => self-blame.
        
      
      Self blame => Past looking, I WAS a failure.
      Self responsibility => Forward looking what CAN I do to make this successful?
      (really itâs the next section, where âself/lifeâ is the relationship)
    
  
  Own your relations
    
      When you point a finger at someone, 3 fingers point back at you.
      All relationships are two ways streets, if thereâs a problem, you own a CHUNK.
      Leave the blame territory, and enter the how do we improve this in the future territory.
      Know what you bring to the relationship, and what is negotiable and non-negotiable from the other party
      Great Anecdote on divorce requirements.
    
  
  Own your needs
    
      BATNA, how you satisfy your needs in case you canât get a WIN/WIN?
      Inner BATNA - know YOU WILL ALWAYS meet your needs, so donât have to worry.
      Gives you confidence that you donât need to be desperate.
    
  
  From blame to responsibility
    
      Touching story about authorâs dying daughter Gabi, and how hard it was to deal with doctors.
      Two top changes:
        
          Needed to stop expecting things from doctorâs they could provide for themselves, and let drâs bring only what they needed to bring, their expertise.
          Needed to stop blaming life for a bum deal, and instead take responsibility for making the most out of what they had.
        
      
    
  


3) Reframe your picture â

Abundance not Scarcity: A rising tide raises all boats

Expecations are a self fulling prophecy. Believe the world good or bad, and thatâs how youâll interpret it, and thatâs how it will become


  Remember your connection to life
  Make your own happiness
  Appreciate lifeâs lessons
  From unfriendly to friendly.


4) Stay in the zone â


  Learn to let go
  Accept the past
  Trust the future
  Embrace the present
  From resistance to acceptance


5) Respect them even if â


  Put yourself in thier shoes
  Expand your circle of respect
  Respect them even if they reject you
  From exclusion to inclusion


6) Give and Recieve â


  Give for mutual gain
  Give for pleasure and meaning
  Give what you are here to give
  From Win/Lose to Win/Win/Win


7) The 3 wins â


  How do we get what we want, while meeting the needs of others?
  The better we meet our own needs, the better we can meet the needs of others
  We choose to be our own ally or our enemy. and we choose to be the ally or enemy in our relationships.
  A win within
    
      I will give myself the most trouble today. I stand in the way of my goals.
      Do the practices in this book, to be satisified with yourself
    
  
  A win with others
    
      Every thing you do to get to yes with yourself, makes it easier to get to yes with others
    
  
  A win for the whole
    
      When you succeed with yourself, and with others, then the whole world benefits
    
  
  Winning the game of life
    
      Itâs about creating inner satisfaction, which makes your life and relationships better. Itâs hard but worth it.

/welcome-to-holland.title: WELCOME TO HOLLAND
/welcome-to-holland.description: âWelcome to Hollandâ articulates expectation, blame, and acceptance in a heart warming easy to read story.

/Human-Meetings.title: FEELINGS/HUMAN MEETINGS
/Human-Meetings.description: Having our emotions heard is a fundamental human need. The modern world denies this need, but that doesnât make the need go away. More then denying the need, society gives, and encourages, us to suppress our emotions. Feelings meetings stand in opposition. They exist to allow us, no, encourage us, to fulfill our fundamental need of expressing emotion.

/brompton-toys.title: MY BROMPTON AND ITS ACCOUTREMENTS
/brompton-toys.description: I LOVE my Brompton, and have spent much time researching accessories for it. Here are the accoutraments Iâve bought for my Brompton, and hopefully itâll save other Brompton owners time, and/or make them aware of accessories they donât known about.

/vim-for-writing.title: VIM FOR WRITING
/vim-for-writing.description: VIM is great at lots of things, but free form writing has a few gaps in âline wrappingâ and âdistraction free visual beautyâ. These gaps can be closed with the plugins Pencil, Goyo and LimeLight.

/Immutable-Laws-Of-Hard.title: THE IMMUTABLE LAWS OF HARD THINGS
/Immutable-Laws-Of-Hard.description: Exercise, Diet, Personal Development, each of these is governed by the immutable laws of hard things. Itâs possible these laws donât apply to you, but I doubt it.

/interviewsarehard.title: BE EASY ON YOURSELF, JOB HUNTS ARE HARD
/interviewsarehard.description: Iâve been hard on myself these last few months as I havenât made a lot of progress on my habits or goals. Reflecting, that shouldnât be a surprise as Iâve been putting a tonne of energy into my job hunt. Here is a reminder of the effort required, which will aid setting realistic expectations during the job hunt.

/voices-in-my-head.title: VOICES IN MY HEAD
/voices-in-my-head.description: The person that most frequently blocks your success is â¦ wait for it â¦ you! Often itâs your subconscious, and often your sub conscious is a bunch of independent voices, many of whom are negative. Itâs very hard to deal with this hidden opposition because itâs so opaque. To help understand your feelings you can name the voices in your head, and imagine asking each of them their positions, and desired outcomes.

/Canadian-Spotting.title: CANADIAN SPOTTING
/Canadian-Spotting.description: âI bet you the bill that dude by the window is Canadian,â I challenged.

/bike.title: BIKING
/bike.description: Biking, is something that make my very happy. I have multiple bikes, here are my notes

/happy.title: HAPPY
/happy.description: Happy is a 5 letter word that many use as the answer to what is the point of life. The follow up question of âHow can you be happyâ is usually followed by a blank stare, so hereâs my study of the subject

/warm.title: STAYING WARM
/warm.description: Staying warm is important, hereâs the gear I use on and off the bike

/tech-health-toys.title: TECH FOR HEALTH
/tech-health-toys.description: Physical health is the basis of my energy, so itâs a place Iâm happy spending money and energy. Iâve been buying lots of technology to help me understand and measure my health and fitness and this post will track my favorite toys.

/physical-health.title: PHYSICAL HEALTH
/physical-health.description: Physical health is the basis of energy, and thus the source of success. Physical health is about weight, fitness and sleep.

/cache.title: SHIPPING INCUBATIONS: CACHE
/cache.description: Internal incubations are fun, but I love shipping products. In the case of Microsoft Cache, before I joined, the team had been incubating OneClip, and needed help bringing it to market. My self and a top tier product manager joined the team to help them ship. We immediately got to work, recruiting senior talent, and closing the gaps. We tackled the technical, product market fit, and logistical issues required to bring the product to market. You can see the features we shipped while the Slashgear article below captures the story well â¦ Instead of simply keeping all its eggs in its own Window 10 or Windows 10 Mobile basket, Microsoft, either officially or through its Garage skunkworks arm, has been steadily putting out mobile apps that cross the platform divide into iOS and Android territory, ranging from the useful to the insane. One of the latest, fortunately, straddles the useful category. Microsoft Garageâs new Cache app lets you clip anything and sync those between Windows and iOS devices. We say ânewâ because, truth be told, it sounds a lot like Microsoftâs âOneClipâ tool from last year. As part of its attempt to modernize its Office suite, Microsoft was spotted working on some new âsmartâ tools, one of which was OneClip. Taking a cue perhaps from OneNote, OneClip would have given users a sort of âstashâ for notes, links, images, and files, accessible from any device. We havenât heard from OneClip since, but that might all be moot now if it has, indeed, evolved into âCacheâ. The basic premise of Cache is totally the same, just independent of Microsoft Office, has a nice interface, and has more features. For example, it remembers where and when you âclippedâ an object, so you can get back to the source if you need it. You can also organize Cacheâs contents by date or into your own custom grouping. But best of all, Cache isnât limited to Windows only. It works on iOS too and the cache is synced on both devices through the cloud. An Android app is still missing, though, and no word yet on when, or even if, that is coming. It would be a terrible shame if it didnât.

/pride.title: THAT IS PRIDE FUCKING WITH YOU
/pride.description: âThat is Pride Fucking With Youâ is the only scene I can quote from any movie. Itâs a powerful scene, and the advice is timeless. Two thousand years ago when a Roman emperor had a victory parade, he was required to have a slave standing behind him holding his helmet high in the air and whispering continuously: âYou are mortal. You are mortalâ. Pride and ego are serious foes that must be kept in check.

/7-habits.title: SEVEN HABITS: A MANUAL FOR LIFE
/7-habits.description: Ever wish you had a user manual for your life? Imagine how reassuring it would be to know you can look up your difficulties in the table of contents, and read the chapter on how to solve your problem. For me, that manual is the The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People and it contains a model which I apply to many of my personal and professional problems and goals.

/software-leadership-roles.title: TECH LEADS, SOFTWARE ARCHITECTS AND ENGINEERING MANAGERS - OH MY!
/software-leadership-roles.description: The line between a technical lead and architect (and product manager and engineering manager) is fuzzy and subjective. The best articulation of difference Iâve found is below copied from Quora. In this classification I like to run a team small enough that I have time to be both an engineering manager and software architect.

/being-a-great-manager.title: BEING A GREAT MANAGER
/being-a-great-manager.description: I aspire not only to be a great manager, but to be the best manager my team members will ever have (unless they get to work for a manager Iâve coached :) ). I hope to have incredibly stiff competition at the top, and Iâll often fall short of my goal, but through trying I will get closer. This post will gather my research on being a great manager, enumerate some of my learnings, and inspire me to be my best.

/moments-at-work.title: MOMENTS AT WORK
/moments-at-work.description: Of all the places we spend our time, work is the one that dominates. However, when we look back on our lives, work is often the thing we remember least. Why? Because we remember our lives through peak moments, and there are few of those, especially positive peak moments, at work. Luckily, peak moments can be created and managers can be taught how to create them. This post explores opportunities and techniques to create these moments.

/magical-memories.title: MAGICAL MEMORIES
/magical-memories.description: Being a dealer of smiles and wonder is a priority in my life, and magic is my instrument. This post details my history and some highlights

/strength-finder.title: MY STRENGTHS FROM  STRENGTH FINDER
/strength-finder.description: Developing you strengths is 3 times as effective as improving your weakness, so find your strengths and double down. To bootstrap the discovery of my strengths, I used a tool called StrengthFinder and it discovered my strengths are Activator, Communication, Problem Solving (Resolver in StrengthFinder speak) Adaptability, and Ideation.

/job.title: MY DREAM JOB
/job.description: Jobs have many dimensions and Iâll describe my dream job in several dimensions. In my dream job I learn the customer and business needs and focus the team on delivering them in a sustainable manner. Simultaneously, I help team members grow, develop our culture, and build valuable tech. When talking to others I prefer a couch to a table, and when I need a break you might see me juggling, practicing magic, or riding my folding bike - often in the office.

/hobby.title: WHY A ENGINEERING MANAGER MASQUERADES AS A MAGICIAN ON THE WEEKENDS

/save-the-soup.title: SAVE THE SOUP
/save-the-soup.description: âAre you insane?â I half shouted at Biff, my college roommate. We had just finished our Operating Systems midterm and were lounging at âThe Bomber,â our college pub. Biff suggested we both do our last internship at Microsoft.

/save-the-souse.title: SAVE THE SOUSE
/save-the-souse.description: Internships are best approached as a long-term field trip. You should plan to be exposed to new things, spend some time out of your comfort zone, and, by all means â use the buddy system.

/sleeping-bag-sacrifies.title: SLEEPING BAG SACRIFICES
/sleeping-bag-sacrifies.description: I started in Windows Azure in 2007. Back then, the name âAzureâ wasnât invented, and Azure was still called âReddog.â I started on the OS team, drawn in by my dream of changing the world, and getting to be Dave Cutlerâs lackey. I didnât get to work with Cutler, but I still may change the world - now that Iâve learned itâs OK to wake sleeping giants. My giant was named Jay.

/what-makes-a-leader.title: WHAT MAKES A LEADER
/what-makes-a-leader.description: Emotional intelligence (EI) is the crux of leadership. EI is comprised of Self-Awareness, Self-Regulation, Motivation, Empathy and Social Skills. This is a summary of Dan Golemanâs What makes a leader. Before we begin, hereâs a consulting 2x2 grid:

/The-Genesis-Node.title: MICROSOFT AZURE - THE GENESIS NODE
/The-Genesis-Node.description: Igor, you know the odds of shipping Azure on time are slim to none.â

/comp.title: CARE ABOUT TOTAL COMPENSATION
/comp.description: Different companies use different compensation models. To compare models use total compensation, not salary. The compensation models are arbitrary and complicated. For example, Amazon clips salary at 160K$/yr, and doesnât have bonuses. Google vests stocks Monthly. Facebook bonuses have a company performance multiplier. At some companies signing bonuses can be over 100% of salary!

/decisive.title: DECISION MAKING 201
/decisive.description: Decisions are hard because we have Narrow Framing, Confirmation Bias, Short Term Emotion and Overconfidence. We can overcome this by Widening our Options, Reality-Testing our Assumptions, Attaining Distance before Deciding and Preparing to Be Wrong.

/what-i-wish-knew-at-22.title: WHAT I WISH I KNEW AT 22 AND SO MIGHT YOU!
/what-i-wish-knew-at-22.description: In 2019 I created a program for 15 fantastic interns! A program highlight was my talk titled âWhat I wish I knew at 22, and so might youâ. The talk received a 94% overall rating from over 15 interns, 10 SDE-IIs, and 1 senior developer. Even though the talk focuses on how to live the good life, a big chunk of life is work, so thereâs good coverage on how to optimize your career.

/the-manager-book.title: IGOR'S BOOK OF MANAGEMENT
/the-manager-book.description: Managing is hard. Lessons are hard earned and should be cherished. This post is designed to make explicit, and improve behaviors and practices. It reminds us how to behave, and encourages continuous improvement.

/the-recruiter-does-not-think-you-are-ho.title: THE RECRUITER DOES NOT THINK YOU'RE HOT
/the-recruiter-does-not-think-you-are-ho.description: Iâve only had one truly unbearable job. It was awful - The code base sucked, the boss had pointed hair, and to top it off I got a terrible review.

/sustainable-work.title: I DON'T WANT TO DIE KNOWING I SPENT TOO MUCH TIME AT WORK, AND I BET YOU DON'T EITHER
/sustainable-work.description:
<!â
Who is the audience?
    - People Iâm looking to recruit to my team.
    - People on my team who can hold me accountable to my aspirations
    - Igor
    - My future employers who want to build this culture
    - My current boss who is trying to figure out what is going on.
    - PART 2: My future employers that want to know why Iâm doing this, and my strategies.

/job-hunt-stress.title: REDUCING JOB HUNT STRESS
/job-hunt-stress.description: Job hunts are stressful, and my goal for job hunts is getting the job I want while minimizing my stress. The stress comes from: lack of confidence, being rushed, not having options, disappointing others and the pressure from current job responsibilities. By expecting and mitigating each of these stressors I greatly reduce stress during my job hunt.

/eulogy.title: IGOR'S EULOGY
/eulogy.description: Wearing a silly hat, his trusty folding bike at his feet, and using a purple fountain pen, Igor âBegan with the end in mindâ with the âimportant but not urgentâ task of penning this eulogy, likely starting at 5am. Igor wanted this life, so he wrote it, he reviewed it, he lived it, and he worked with his family, friends, and multitude of mentors, to adjust and tweak it.

/mortality-software.title: TIME.LTD - MORTALITY SOFTWARE
/mortality-software.description: Life is finite, time is limited. Mortality software helps us understand and then ensure we are using our precious time well. It helps us create our future and reflect on our past. The poem based elevator pitch:

/mind-monsters.title: MIND MONSTERS
/mind-monsters.description: Last night I was having trouble sleeping so I plopped down on the couch to watch infomercials. The infomercial I picked was religious in nature, and was talking about mind monsters.

/insomnia.title: WHAT I SHOULD DO WHEN I CAN'T SLEEP
/insomnia.description: If you want advice on how to deal with insomnia, do NOT ask a person who hasnât slept in two nights. Instead, ask someone whoâs had insomnia several times, and has a checklist on how to respond when insomnia flares up. By the way, Iâve never actually taken this advice, but maybe writing it down will make it more likely that Iâll take it in the future.

/dip.title: THE DIP - SHOULD YOU FOLD OR DOUBLE DOWN
/dip.description: New things start fun, but once the new wears off they are hard because of the Dip. The Dip is the long slog between starting and mastery. Unlike Dips, cul-de-sacs are places you can put in a lot of energy and nothing will come of it. You need to quit cul-de-sacs and lean into dips. Much of our failure comes from being distracted by tasks we donât have the guts to quit. Winners quit all the time. They quit the right stuff, so their energy can be saved to cross the Dip.

/moments.title: ENGINEERING MOMENTS
/moments.description: Take a few seconds to close your eyes and think back on an important memory. In that moment, did you feel a sense of elevation? Did you experience insight? Have a sense of pride? Make a connection? In the power of moments, the attributes of powerful moments are understood so that they can be better engineered.

/90days.title: THE FIRST 90 DAYS
/90days.description: A how to guide for starting your next job.

/addiction.title: ADDICTION
/addiction.description: Addiction is not about drugs or alcohol - it is about escape. Quoting âDo the Workâ: When we canât stand the fear, the shame, and the self-reproach that we feel, we obliterate it with an addiction. The addiction becomes the shadow version, the evil twin of our calling to service or to art. Thatâs why addicts are so interesting and so boring at the same time. Theyâre interesting because theyâre called to something â something new, something unique, something that we, watching, canât wait to see them bring forth into manifestation. At the same time, theyâre boring because they never do the work. The addiction becomes his purpose, his novel, his adventure, his great love. The work of art or service that might have been produced is replaced by the drama, conflict, and suffering of the addictâs crazy, haunted, shattered life.

/toysfortots.title: DONATING TO CHARITY
/toysfortots.description: One of the most satisfying (and fun) projects I worked on in my career was giving Alexa customers the ability to donate to charity and then have Amazon match their donations

/amazon.title: MY THOUGHTS ON  AMAZON
/amazon.description: I spent 4 years working at Amazon, some things I loved, some not so much. Amazon is a huge company and the variation of behavior within a company exceeds the variation between the âmedianâ behavior between companies. Even within the two teams I was on at Amazon I saw the exact opposite behaviors. When I talk about the good, Iâll talk about the ideal good, and when I talk about the bad, Iâll talk to some issues I saw that were systemically bad. As a result youâll often see me describing something as both good and bad, as itâs done differently in different parts of the company.

/coe.title: LEARNING FROM MISTAKES
/coe.description: Everyone can make a mistake once, thatâs totally fine. Repeating mistakes is unacceptable. Correction of Errors (COE) is the name Amazon gives itâs mechanism for correcting errors. Microsoft uses the term Root cause analysis (RCA), itâs the same concept. This mechanism originated with service outages but can be applied for any âerrorâ, like missing your sons kindergarden graduation, or getting fired.

/covid.title: NOTES FROM COVID 19
/covid.description: Corona Virus (CV) may be the defining moment in our lives. In such times, lets remember three things 1) Keep your circle of concern within your circle of influence 2) Donât feed mind monsters - see the positive 3) In crisis, you see both the best and worse. Focus on the best.

/depression.title: THE OPPOSITE OF DEPRESSION IS NOT HAPPINESS, IT'S VITALITY
/depression.description: When youâre depressed you donât think youâve put on a gray veil - seeing the world through the haze of a bad mood. You think that a veil has been taken away. The veil of happiness, and you believe youâre seeing the world as it truly is: alone, petrifying, and painful. But the truth lies. The depressed say âNo one loves me.â And you say, âI love you, your wife loves you, your mother loves you.â and the depressed ignore you. The depressed will continue, âNone of this matters, weâre just going to die in the end.â To which you have to say, âThatâs true, but I think right now should focus on what to have for breakfast.â

/facebook.title: MY THOUGHTS ON FACEBOOK
/facebook.description: Give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together, here are my in progress notes on working at FB.

/goals.title: GOALS - HOW TO DEFINE AND ENSURE SUCCESS
/goals.description: Goal are critcal, there are multiple goal systems and they have consequences. They are mechansims to deliver without micro managements.

/gtd.title: GETTING THINGS DONE
/gtd.description: Getting Things Done (GTD) is a model based on David Allenâs book of the same name. Itâs a deep dive into Habit 3 - first things first, with some lite weight Habit 2 - begin with the end in mind, mixed in for good measure. By using GTD religiously you can have a drastic reduction in stress and procrastination.

/idle.title: YOUR IDLE LOOP
/idle.description: Waiting in line at the grocery store, sitting in an Uber, pooping - in these invisible times, we execute our idle loop. We spend a lot of time in our idle loop, and it can either increase our energy or drain it. By being aware of and then modifiying how we spend our idle loop we can improve our lives one poop at a time.

/micro-economics.title: MICRO ECONOMICS
/micro-economics.description: Supply, demands and markets, oh my!

/death.title: ON BEING MORTAL - GUESS WHAT? YOU'RE DYING
/death.description: Bad news, youâre dying, so is everyone else. Good news, if we didnât die weâd run out of resources, and our kids would be screwed. Bad news, our health care system is optimized for keeping you alive, not for maximizing the enjoyable time you have on earth. Good news, knowing is half the battle - armed with this knowledge you can decide how you want to die, which is ultimately how you want to live.

/psychic-weight.title: PSYCHIC WEIGHT
/psychic-weight.description: Imagine a weight tied around your body, imagine it dragging behind you, slowing down your motions, preventing you from going where you want to go. Imagine never taking it of, and getting now relief regardless of when you sit or sleep. Now imagine thatâs not a physical weight, but instead a mental weight, a psychic weight if you will. Psychic weight are the thoughts that prevent your mind and emotions from being fluid and light.

/remote-work.title: REMOTE WORK
/remote-work.description: In March 2020, the world shut down from Covid 19. In May 2020, I started a new job as a remote manager at FB. Here are my thoughts

/parkinson.title: PARKINSON'S LAW: THE PARADOX OF PLENTY
/parkinson.description: Work expands to fill the resources available. The more you make the more you spend. Stuff expands to fill the space available for storage. etc, etc.

/shame.title: SHAME
/shame.description: Shame and guilt are similar emotions that lead to contrasting behaviors. Shame drives people to hide or deny their wrongdoings while guilt drives people to amend their mistakes.

/timeoff.title: GETTING THE MOST OUT OF TIME OFF
/timeoff.description: Time off is critical, itâs how we renew our energy, find our creativity, etc. Many people think of time off as synonymous with vacation, but I think there are 2 kinds of time off. Vacation, and personal development.

/upstream.title: UPSTREAM - HOW TO SOLVE PROBLEMS BEFORE THEY HAPPEN
/upstream.description: Imagine sitting enjoying a picnic with a friend at the side of a river. Suddenly you see a kid drowning, you and your friend dive in and save him. A few minutes later the same thing happens. When the third kid comes down river, your friend runs away. You scream at him - why the hell arenât you helping. He replies, Iâm running upstream to stop the bastard whoâs throwing kids into the river. Upstream is the idea of solving problems before they start. Itâs the basis of habit 3, First Things First, where we tackle the important not urgent.

/quip.title: QUIP TIPS AND TRICKS
/quip.description: My group lives in QUIP. Here are some tips for my quip usage.

/frog.title: EAT THAT FROG
/frog.description: Procrastination is the success killer, a powerful manifestations of the resistance. Eat that frog gives gives 21 antidotes to get it done, this is my re-framing of the concepts into my favorite mental models, the chapter titles are preserved if you want to go look them up.

/mind-at-work.title: BODY AT HOME, MIND AT WORK
/mind-at-work.description: I have a problem, an addiction, an addiction so detrimental to quality of life, it should be described as a disease. This disease is not being present. There are many symptoms of the disease, but today Iâm going to talk about my most frequent symptoms, my body being at home, but my mind still being at work

/anxiety.title: ANXIETY, THE GAP BETWEEN REALITY AND EXPECTATIONS
/anxiety.description:
Anxiety is the difference between reality and expectations. It is the pain, while stress is the suffering. The
pain of anxiety is designed for threatening circumstance drawing your attention for a problem requiring urgent attention. This narrows your perspective allowing you to focus on a resolution. However, like many autonomous systems anxiety can be over triggered, and handled poorly without deliberate action.

/td/advertising.title: ADVERTISING
/td/advertising.description: Advertising is 155 billion business in the USA. Of that 155B, 85B is Digital and 70B is TV(digital platforms are invest ing in video to capture the TV spend. This post captures my understanding of that world.

/td/fix_ssh.title: SSH CLIENT COMMANDS TIMING OUT FROM SOME CLIENTS SOME TIMES
/td/fix_ssh.description: For some reason, SSH is just hanging out of no where. To debug on the server, be sure to open your firewall

/td/hack-web.title: HACKING THE WEB FOR FUN AND PROFIT

/td/back_ref.title: ADDING BACK REFERENCES TO MY BLOG
/td/back_ref.description:
This blog is essentially my collection of [evergreen notes](), a place to have
my thinking accrue. The blog is densely linked, in the forward direction, but
jekyll does not create back links. I think backlinks would be great. Here's my
strategy to create them. ### When to compute back links v0 - run a one off
script, similar to how I build search indexes. ### Back link computation
methodology Standard how to build a search engine question. Plan: Go through
allow list of backlist pages (enumerate collections, remove indexes) For each
page, build a list of referenced pages, and add them to a map of page to
reference. Go through the map, and apply them (title, list of references) to
pages. ### How to Inject back links into the output content Inject into source
or output Need to inject into source as output is regenerated. It's a pain as
it's a source edit and that dirties history, but can probably come up with a way
to keep that clean - in some kind of auto generated guards, and make an atomic
checkin.

/d/2010-2-15-2016-Misc-Uncategorized.title: RANDOM UN CATEGORIZED NOTES
/d/2010-2-15-2016-Misc-Uncategorized.description:
There are lots of rough ideas I have that are not yet categorized, or good enough to be a thought. This will be a
place to store them.

/d/2015-11-18-Outsourcing.title: ON OUTSOURCING
/d/2015-11-18-Outsourcing.description: Time is my precious resource - I have a limited number of hours in my life, and once Iâve used them, I never get them back. However, I can preserve my time by outsourcing activities that donât have high enough return on investment. This post reminds me to outsource by enumerating my position on outsourcing, and the things I have outsourced.

/d/2015-11-18-what-is-strategy.title: ON STRATEGY
/d/2015-11-18-what-is-strategy.description: Strategy is creating fit among a companyâs activities. The success of a strategy depends on doing many things well and integrating among them. If there is no fit among activities, there is no distinctive strategy and little sustainability. Management reverts to the simpler task of overseeing independent functions, and improving operational effectiveness, a race to the bottom.

/d/2015-11-20-Emotional-Health-Practices.title: EMOTIONAL HEALTH PRACTICES
/d/2015-11-20-Emotional-Health-Practices.description: Emotionally healthy folks can let it go, empathize with others, and most importantly, sleep well at night. Just like physically healthy folks do physical practices, like walking daily, stretching, biking, there are also emotional practices. Here are the ones Iâve been exploring.

/d/2016-2-14-Health-In-The-Head.title: EMOTIONAL HEALTH IN MY HEAD
/d/2016-2-14-Health-In-The-Head.description: Fit in my head, isnât fit in reality. In the last few years Iâve learned this lesson for physical health, and now Iâm learning it for emotional health.

/d/2016-2-15-Seth-Godin-Notes.title: SETH GODIN- IDEAS
/d/2016-2-15-Seth-Godin-Notes.description: Seth godin has many ideas that are critical in the new world. Ideas include: Choosing yourself, Tribes, The limited value of cogs, connection, and the dip.

/d/2016-3-12-sleight-of-mouth.title: SLEIGHT OF MOUTH
/d/2016-3-12-sleight-of-mouth.description: Sleight of mind is about how to cause cognative reframes.

/d/2016-05-09-lost-interview.title: STEVE JOBS -- THE LOST INTERVIEW
/d/2016-05-09-lost-interview.description: Uneditted notes on a Q+A with Steve Jobs.

/d/2016-6-10-Appreciate.title: APPRECIATE
/d/2016-6-10-Appreciate.description: Think of the last time you were appreciated: How did you feel? Think about the last hour: How many things could you have appreciated? It takes 7 positive experiences to make up for 1 negative experience - what can you be appreciating?

/d/2016-6-25-Business-Model-You.title: BUSINESS MODEL YOU
/d/2016-6-25-Business-Model-You.description: The business model canvas is a tool for understanding how a company makes money. We can apply the same canvas to a person, in this article, itâll be me.

/d/2016-7-14-Customer-Service.title: COMPANIES WITH CUSTOMER OBSESSION
/d/2016-7-14-Customer-Service.description: Customer obsession, manifest in customer service, can be a key differentiator. This post explores the benefits, and business model impact of a customer obsessed organization.

/d/2016-8-1-Twelve-Tech-Forces.title: 12 TECH FORCES THAT WILL SHAPE OUR FUTURE
/d/2016-8-1-Twelve-Tech-Forces.description: The digital revolution has gone through 3 changes: the copy of the industrial age, the link age, and the streaming age. This is a summary of the concepts representing the new age.

/d/2016-09-18-transportation-as-a-servic.title: TRANSPORTATION AS A SERVICE
/d/2016-09-18-transportation-as-a-servic.description:
Carâs have had an incredible impact on our society, and it will be disrupted by transportation as a service. This summarizes Johnâs Zimmers article
the third transportation revolution.

/d/2017-2-5-To-Sell-Is-Human.title: TO SELL IS HUMAN
/d/2017-2-5-To-Sell-Is-Human.description: To sell is human is a treatise on the modern form of sales. Part I describes why selling is important, and how it has evolved. Part II focuses on the how to be a salesman and Part III focuses on what you need to do to do sales.

/d/2017-04-09-igor-the-operating-manual.title: IGOR THE OPERATING MANUAL
/d/2017-04-09-igor-the-operating-manual.description: Iâve learned what I like, how I want to spend my energy,and how I want to be thinking about my life. Iâve learned my roles, reasonable expectations, and healthy ways to operate given my personality, behaviors, and frequently occurring situations. This post is a summary of those learnings - an operating manual if you will, reminding me how to think about, respond to and behave, so I can operate at maximum effectiveness and efficiency.

/d/2017-07-22-vacationphotos.title: VACATION PHOTOS
/d/2017-07-22-vacationphotos.description: Vacation photos are great, they remind you of the good times youâve had, the people youâve had them with and the places youâve had them at. Here are my tips for vacation photos, and âreminiscingâ type photos in general.

/d/2017-09-10-software-rot.title: SOFTWARE-ROT
/d/2017-09-10-software-rot.description: After a year of not working on one of my hobby software projects, I decided itâd be fun to make a minor change - should only be few lines of code. Should be easier still since I followed all the project best practices: I had full unit tests, and a fully automated command line build but boy was I wrong.

/d/2017-11-04-clean-architecture.title: CLEAN ARCHITECTURE
/d/2017-11-04-clean-architecture.description: Architecture is the highest level of abstraction that models a software system. The architecture is composed from modules, which are composed of objects, which are composed of functions. Design is applied to each of these layers, and when executed successfully results in a system that is easy to build and maintain. Clean architecture discusses designs at a high level, which like architecture is highly useful. On the topic of architecture, the software industryâs use of the word architect is confusing. The construction analog of a âsoftware architectâ is a âstructural engineerâ and the software equivalent of a âconstruction architectâ is a product manager.

/d/2016-02-03-positive-computing-survey.title: POSITIVE COMPUTING A WHIRLWIND TOUR
/d/2016-02-03-positive-computing-survey.description: Positive computing is the software branch focused on increasing human well being. Similar to positive psychology, it is a brand new field and our industry has barely begun. Iâll use this post to gather my half baked thoughts on the various applications Iâve seen. For now itâll be confusing as Iâm brain dumping to various audiences with various knowledge.

/d/2018-02-10-you-do-want-your-favorite-.title: SOFTWARE AS A SERVICE IS GOOD FOR USERS
/d/2018-02-10-you-do-want-your-favorite-.description: When selling subscription software, a publisher needs to continue to prove the value of thier software, or users will not renew their contracts. This is very beneficial to the users and to the publisher.

/d/habits.title: ATOMIC HABITS
/d/habits.description: Habits are the automatic actions, both positive and negative, you take through your life. Atomic Habits describes how to change habits, itâs the how-to manual for âSharpening the Sawâ.

/d/resistance.title: RESISTANCE: WHY YOU CAN'T MAKE YOURSELF TAKE AN ICE COLD SHOWER
/d/resistance.description: Stop. Take an ice cold shower right now. You didnât, did you? Trust me, even if you tried, you wouldnât. Before you turned on the water, youâd have this irrational fear of stepping in and you wouldnât do it. The force that stops you is the resistance. The resistance is the personification of the force that stops you from doing the important. The resistance lies, telling us things are hard, when they are not. The resistance adds suffering, when there is minimal pain - and that confuses us, stopping us from doing the things which give us the most value, joy, and positive identity.

/d/where-have-all-the-bugs-gone.title: WHERE HAVE ALL THE BUGS GONE
/d/where-have-all-the-bugs-gone.description: Iâve been a software developer since 2001, and back then we used to have lots of bugs. Now a days, it seems we donât have bugs, and Iâve wondered why. Now we have tickets which we get from our systems running in operations, but thatâs quite different. Whatâs going on?
